page.title: 12Local History
page.content: There is a site of a Roman villa 400m south of Stowe Farm, but nothing is visible above ground, and no detailed archeological excavations have been made. 1\ Km north of Stowe Hill is an ancient British hill-fort known as Caer Caradoc after the Saxon chief, known to the Romans as Caractacus, who led resistance against the Romans and local tradition says he made his last stand within the defensive walls of the camp before being captured. The steep approach on the north-east and south sides, and the three grass- covered earth walls and ditches rising to 6\m and enclosing an oval area of 400 x 250 m are still an impressive monument of engineering that has lasted for 2,000 years.
